t: For the choir director. A Maskil of David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul and said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”
Why*pn do you boast in evil, O mighty man? The*ln lovingkindness of God endures*i all day long.
Your*ln tongue devises destruction, Like*ln a sharp razor, O worker of deceit.
You*ln love evil more than good, Falsehood*ln more than speaking what is right. Selah.
You*ln love all words that devour, O*ln deceitful tongue.
But*ln God will break you down forever; He*ln will snatch you up and tear you away from your*i tent, And*ln uproot you from the land of the living. Selah.
The*ln righteous will see and fear, And*ln will laugh at him, saying,*i
“Behold,*ln the man who would not make God his refuge, But*ln trusted in the abundance of his riches And*iln was strong in his evil*i desire.”
But*ln as for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I*ln trust in the lovingkindness of God forever and ever.
I*ln will give You thanks forever, because You have done it,*i And*ln I will wait on Your name, for it*i is*i good, in the presence of Your godly ones.
